website_summaries.verdict: The TerraMaster F2-210 is an affordable dual-drive NAS device that delivered solid file transfer performance in testing, but somewhat skimps on features.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, great features for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first nas and I picked a perfect one to start off with. Super easy to install hard drives and fortunately comes with a screw driver, so you don't have to find one. Once hard drives are installed you just need to follow the online instructions and your set up in no time. Just a word of warning that any hard drives you install will need formatting first.
customer_reviews.author: T OXLEY

customer_reviews.title: Good for HD Films
customer_reviews.text: Very good value for money ! Things to know : it’s very good for full HD films , music and pictures ! But if you want watch 4K films I recommend F2-220 as this one struggling a little with transcoding. Although I must say it’s a great peace of gear and I’m very pleased withe performance, aluminium case make it durable plus it’s very quiet! Terra master support is simply astonishing and I have never seen such a quick email response Truly recommend for HD films and other multimedia content, working great on Plex and Emby , could have more apps available but I assume it will come with time ! Thanks !
customer_reviews.author: Nikolay

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable NAS
customer_reviews.text: The NAS by Terramaster is very unreliable. I purchased 2 RED WD 4tb matched drives to operate a RAID 1 setup. The drive continually disappears from the network. Front start button does not shut the system down. Only power down from the main power socket. Judging from the comments on Terramaster forum the product seems to be in virtual beta. During the brief times when the NAS was working it did not seem to be capable of running PLEX or EMBY servers without locking up. My problem is I have put my faith in this product Terramaster F2 -210 and transferred my music and photos which does not look to be retrievable now. Returning to Amazon for refund
customer_reviews.author: Bigmac 747

customer_reviews.title: Noisy Not fit for purpose
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as my media centre for to store all my movie's and music on the apps that come with it are limited and are a pain to install they show they are installed but then later show there not absolutely useless! Also has a very high pitched noise which annoys everyone in the house so have to keep it switched off emailed Terramaster and just got a reply asking me to check out a few things which I have not had time to do yet but might be sending it back as the way it is at the moment is not fit for purpose! Very disappointed but on the plus side looks good!
customer_reviews.author: MR DAVID J OBRINE

customer_reviews.title: Well priced alternative to rivals and stable!
customer_reviews.text: After a bit of a rocky start these guys have made good and I can do exactly what I need to do. Create iscsi targets, aggregate links and run Plex comfortably. The App Store is plentiful and device can support docker which allows you to run apps without needing full stack os environments for what you need to do. Comparable hardware and noticeably cheaper than other brands. If any nitpicking is to be done I’d say it’s the firmware, but, if you know what you are doing you can get round those issues. It is a little plastic-y but mine is in a (well ventilated!) cupboard and keeps quite enough. Even with 5 disks spinning at full toot.
customer_reviews.author: cmatt

customer_reviews.title: rubbish faulty bay from delivery
customer_reviews.text: going back due to a fault with left hand side bay not detecting the hdd def fault with bay as new hdd was detected after in another device. if I wanted a single bay nas I would have purchased a single bay nas not good at all. looks like I am going to have to get another nas which reads and detects both bays and has plex support built in
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Still a long way to go...
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed in this and had to return it in the end. Apart from a somewhat sluggish UI, the unit's sleep mode would not work. My experience also included several other little annoyances, such as not being able to access the Transmission web interface from another browser on my local network (something which I never had issues with on my previous NAS). Most frustrating of all however, was when I discovered that several of the apps the company advertises as being available with its operating system (TOS) were not actually available for this unit and there is no disclaimer on their website concerning this. Great tech support though, very fast and responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebus

customer_reviews.title: Failed to live up to expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I spent some time looking for a NAS to replace my homeserver. After installing a new HDD the initial setup failed to see the HDD. A reboot showed the HDD. 3 hours later after copying about 500gb to the NAS, the NAS dropped off the network. The NAS then repeatedly dropped off the network after rebooting it. Returning it to Amazon. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: TerraMaster F2-210 2-bay excellent product excellent service
customer_reviews.text: This is my first forray into the world of Nas, i ended up choosing the TerraMaster brand from all the excellent reviews on Amazon and also youtube, on recieving the Nas, the setup was really easy and before i new it all my files were transfered and i had access to them from all my devices, now all my media is one place my grandkids love it as they can listen to music or watch films on any device from anywhere. Thank you for providing a really great product and service.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: It is so Reliable and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Set it up as a Home Server so all at home can watch videos and work on their documents. (set to RAID 1). Finally used one of the non-RAID hard disks as a backup drive for my Windows 10 laptop. It works very well snd is quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Keith L

customer_reviews.title: Product has potential but poor reliability
customer_reviews.text: Looks great at a good price but after nearly two weeks of trying I still can't get the drive to map consistently and Onedrive has stopped working after the last update. The Plex app didn't install correctly initially and when OneDrive was working it was taking ages to sync files. There is no UK support and the time difference is very inconvenient. I've lost faith in this product now and it will be sent back to Amazon asap.
customer_reviews.author: 93Nosbig

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO SET UP AND VERY QUIET
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a faulty Lenovo device. The setup is very simple and it comes with a beautiful Linux based OS to configure it and set up the apps. Using 2 x 4GB WD Reds in Raid1.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple setup (NAS)
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with how simple this NAS was to set up, works great as a RAID 1 set up, easy to attach an external drive via USB, and the NAS software works on my Apple iMac, Windows 10 PC and Android phone.
customer_reviews.author: JamesEdwardCharles

customer_reviews.title: LED's flash, a few beeps and NAS reboots every 15 seconds
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the issue is but while copying over some files this NAS seems to have broke. It's in a constant reboot, with and without disks installed. Not happy really as I can't get onto the web interface quick enough to be able to see what the issue might be. Draining the power has had no effect. Will probably return in the next day or two.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Its a good piece of tec
customer_reviews.text: Im glad i got this, does exactly what i wanted, i now have all my stuff back up on 2 drives, alot of worry about losing my stuff has gone now, its fairly easy to set up, and i can access my stuff easily on my pc and phone
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: fairly easy to set up, working fine no problems so far, bought as i am now working from home and wanted a back up
customer_reviews.author: Ray Morton

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: Had the product less than six months, all I can say I see why it’s cheap, mine has broken, keeps beeping and dropping out power wise, lost 3 terabytes of data. Terra master has lack of material to try and fix it
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Tech support was superb
customer_reviews.text: User manual was sparse and, as a first time user it was tricky to set up. It ended with Tech support coming onto my PC remotely to sort it out. Can't fault them there but I do wish there was a comprehensive user manual somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Joe birch

customer_reviews.title: Built quality
customer_reviews.text: As a photographer let me recommend TerraMaster F2-210 for all photographers whoever needed a perfect solution to archive photos. I also use it for multimedia streaming and some webserver function! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: bokehmaster.uk

customer_reviews.title: A bit slow but does the trick for home use
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for simple backups etc, but running SQL server etc definitely too slow. Will do just fine for what i need right now.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great, works as described! Nice, little device 👌
customer_reviews.text: It works great, I use it to storage just simple media content, and some documents on to it. I do wish the application store had "more" to it, just seemed kind of limited compared to other NAS brands, for example, Synology.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: A reboot will kill it
customer_reviews.text: It's really cheap, the interface looks great, and it's incredibly easy to set up. Just don't put anything you care about on it, because it can sometimes lose all its config (and your data) just by restarting it. Unfortunately, that's the entire point of a NAS, so it't pretty much just a loud paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Declan M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing NAS media centre
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing, extremely fast, extremely quiet and with so many features. I absolutely love it. We use it to stream videos and there is no lag or any issues with it at all. The iphone and windows software is amazing. 5*
customer_reviews.author: Bunty Kainth

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL JUNK - Dont bother better getting a second hand QNAS than this!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is junk, don't but it get a good brand make its worth the extra. Had nothing but issues with it and the tech support is next to useless!!!
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: Disapointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for backup my Macs with TimeMachine. The first backup succeeded, after that the TerraMaster wasn't discoverable by the Mac, PC had no problems connecting to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeroenn van den Belt

customer_reviews.title: Basic
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. Looked mid range prosumer. I wish I had spent a bit more time qualifying the purchase before making it. If you want simple, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Christoph Er

customer_reviews.title: How simple
customer_reviews.text: Download the app; very simple to set up / install and get up and running. Very easy, even for the non computer savvy people out there. (I include myself in that statement).
customer_reviews.author: Normsy_boy

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job don
customer_reviews.text: Works grate no problems been running for 2 months perfectly gets the job don
customer_reviews.author: russell

customer_reviews.title: Very straightforward
customer_reviews.text: Perfect device for a newbie, easy to follow set up. Faultless so far.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for backing up data
customer_reviews.text: It is a very versatile backup machine takes some getting used to and I found playing with the settings before backing up a good idea to get what I wanted out of it very good machine
customer_reviews.author: Fred

product_meta.title: TerraMaster F2-210 2-bay NAS Quad Core Raid Enclosure Media Server Personal Cloud Storage (Diskless)
feature_bullets: An affordable, high-performance 2-bay NAS optimized for home and SOHO users, running the latest TOS 4.1.x operating system.
ARM v8 quad-core 1.4GHz CPU with 1 GB RAM (not upgradeable), blazingly fast read/write speeds of more than 114 MB/s(RAID 0, WD Red 4TB x 2).

Supports Emby and Plex media servers, which keep your videos, music, and photos personal media beautifully organized, always ready for on-demand streaming to your PC, mobile device, smart TV, or games console.
Compatible drive - 3.5" and 2.5" SATA HDD; 2.5" SATA SSD. Maximum Single Volume Size:16TB. For stable performance, it is recommended to use Seagate IronWolf and WD Red hard drives.
Supports docker, cloud drive sync, multiple backups, remote access and mobile app. Dozens of free applications; Ultra-quiet heat dissipation technology.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars394 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
